issues.title: Coolant Pipe Failures
issues.symptoms: Coolant loss, overheating warning, coolant puddles, sweet smell, temperature fluctuation
issues.description: The 991 continues to use plastic coolant pipes in the cooling system. These pipes run from the front radiators to the rear engine and are subjected to heat cycling and vibration. They can crack, especially at connection points, causing coolant loss. The coolant transfer pipe in particular is a known failure point.
fixes: Replace plastic coolant pipes with aluminum upgrade
Coolant transfer pipe replacement (common failure)
Replace expansion tank if showing age
Water pump replacement as preventive maintenance
Flush and refill with proper coolant mix

repairCosts.notes: Continues plastic pipe tradition. Aluminum upgrades available.

issues.title: Carbon Buildup on Intake Valves (DFI Engines)
issues.symptoms: Rough idle, misfires, reduced power, poor fuel economy, hesitation under load
issues.description: All 991 engines use direct fuel injection (DFI), meaning fuel doesn't wash over the intake valves. Carbon deposits accumulate on the valve backs and intake ports, restricting airflow and affecting engine performance. This is a maintenance item requiring periodic walnut blasting, typically every 50,000-80,000 miles depending on driving style.
fixes: Walnut shell blasting (standard solution)
Chemical treatments (less invasive but less effective)
Catch can installation to reduce oil vapor deposits
Use Top Tier fuel with good detergent packages
Spirited driving helps but doesn't eliminate buildup

repairCosts.notes: All 991 engines are DFI. Walnut blasting needed periodically.

issues.title: PDK Transmission Issues
issues.symptoms: Harsh shifts, jerky low-speed operation, shuddering, warning lights, delayed engagement
issues.description: The PDK dual-clutch transmission is generally reliable but can develop issues. Low-speed jerkiness, especially when cold, is common and may be normal for the system. More serious issues include clutch pack wear, mechatronic unit failures, and software glitches. PDK fluid should be serviced despite Porsche's 'lifetime' fill claim.
fixes: PDK fluid change (recommended every 50,000-60,000 miles)
Software updates to address shift quality
Clutch adaptation reset via PIWIS diagnostic
Clutch pack replacement if severely worn
Mechatronic unit repair for electronic issues

repairCosts.notes: Fluid service recommended every 50-60k despite 'lifetime' fill.

issues.title: PASM Suspension Damper Failures
issues.symptoms: PASM warning light, harsh ride, damper leaking, clunking noises, uneven handling
issues.description: PASM (Porsche Active Suspension Management) dampers use electronic valving to adjust stiffness. These dampers can fail, usually by leaking or developing electrical issues. A failed damper triggers a warning light and the system may default to a fixed setting. PASM dampers are expensive compared to conventional shocks.
fixes: Diagnose with Porsche diagnostic tool (PIWIS)
Replace failed PASM damper (OEM or remanufactured)
Some owners convert to quality coilovers when multiple fail
Check wiring and connectors before replacing damper
Remanufactured dampers available at reduced cost

issues.title: Oil Consumption Concerns
issues.symptoms: Low oil warnings, need to add oil between changes, blue smoke on startup, oil smell
issues.description: Some 991.1 models exhibit higher than expected oil consumption. Porsche's stated acceptable consumption is up to 1 quart per 1,000 miles, which many owners find excessive. Direct injection, high compression, and tight tolerances contribute. Tracking oil level is important, and the car should not be run low on oil.
fixes: Monitor oil level regularly using on-board system
Keep oil level in proper range (not overfilled)
Some owners report improvement with different oil brands
Severe consumption may indicate piston ring issues
Compression and leak-down test for diagnosis

repairCosts.notes: 991.1 may consume oil. Monitor and top up. Severe cases need diagnosis.

issues.title: Twin-Turbo Specific Issues (991.2)
issues.symptoms: Boost inconsistency, wastegate rattle, turbo whine, check engine light, reduced power
issues.description: The 991.2 moved to twin-turbo engines for all models. While generally reliable, the turbos can develop issues including wastegate rattle, actuator problems, and seal failures. Turbo feed and drain lines need monitoring. These engines are more complex than the naturally aspirated 991.1.
fixes: Wastegate actuator adjustment or replacement
Turbo oil line inspection and replacement
Intercooler inspection for leaks
Boost leak testing if low power complaints
Proper warm-up and cool-down for turbo longevity

repairCosts.notes: 991.2 twin-turbo. Wastegate rattle and boost issues.

issues.title: Convertible Top Issues (Cabriolet)
issues.symptoms: Slow operation, error messages, hydraulic leaks, top doesn't complete cycle, fabric wear
issues.description: The 991 Cabriolet's power top system is complex and can develop age-related issues. Hydraulic pump wear, microswitch failures, and ram seal leaks cause operational problems. The fabric top can wear at stress points, and the rear window can develop issues. Proper operation and storage help longevity.
fixes: Hydraulic system inspection and fluid top-off
Hydraulic pump replacement if failing
Microswitch adjustment or replacement
Top fabric replacement for worn or damaged tops
System reset procedure after battery work

issues.title: Electric Steering Column Issues
issues.symptoms: Creaking noise, steering feel inconsistency, steering wheel off-center, warning lights
issues.description: The 991 uses an electric power steering system. While generally reliable, some owners report issues with the steering column producing creaking noises, especially when turning at low speeds. There can also be software-related issues affecting steering feel or causing warning messages.
fixes: Steering column lubrication for creaking
Software update for steering feel issues
Steering rack inspection if play detected
Steering angle sensor recalibration
Full diagnosis with Porsche diagnostic tool

repairCosts.notes: Creaking from column. Lubrication often helps.

guides.title: Coolant Pipe Upgrade
guides.description: Replace plastic coolant pipes with aluminum upgrade for reliability.

guides.title: Intake Valve Carbon Cleaning
guides.description: Walnut shell blasting procedure to remove carbon buildup.

diyGuides.title: Oil Change
diyGuides.description: Complete oil and filter change for 991.1 and 991.2 engines.

diyGuides.title: Brake Pad Replacement
diyGuides.description: Front and rear brake pad replacement with sensor reset.

diyGuides.title: Spark Plug Replacement
diyGuides.description: Replace spark plugs on the flat-6 engine.

diyGuides.title: Cabin Filter Replacement
diyGuides.description: Replace the cabin air filter for fresh interior air.
